main_definition: To be continuously present or in existence; to occur at all times, without exception.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Used for emphasis to indicate that something is a constant truth or certainty.
meanings_and_examples.example: I always enjoy reading books on weekends.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To do something without fail, constantly and persistently.
meanings_and_examples.example: She promises to visit her grandmother every single Sunday.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Always in the past; at all times before now.
meanings_and_examples.example: He always used to walk his dog early in the morning.
The rain was falling always during that stormy night.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Fully and completely; with no exceptions or exclusions.
meanings_and_examples.example: In his heart, he always loved her above all others.
